info.title: JustCall
info.description:
REST APIs 
 The REST APIs provide programmatic access to read and write JustCall data. Create a new contact, read them, add notes, and more

get.description: Retrieve all calls linked to an account or refine the call selection as needed by utilizing the numerous query parameter fields.

parameters.name: fetch_queue_data
parameters.description: Set fetch_queue_data to true to fetch queue data like callback time, callback status, callback wait duration, etc. Default entry is false.

parameters.name: fetch_ai_data
parameters.description: Set fetch_ai_data to true to fetch coaching data by Justcall AI. Default entry is false.

parameters.name: from_datetime
parameters.description: Datetime in yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss or yyyy-mm-dd format starting from when the calls are to be fetched in user's timezone.

parameters.name: to_datetime
parameters.description: Datetime in yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss or yyyy-mm-dd format till when the calls are to be fetched in user's timezone.

parameters.name: contact_number
parameters.description:
Number of the contact for which calls are to be fetched.
Important: Please provide a valid contact number with country code.

parameters.name: justcall_number
parameters.description: JustCall number for which the calls are to be fetched.

parameters.name: agent_id
parameters.description: ID of the agent for whom the calls are to be fetched. Agent ID can be accessed using List all users API.

parameters.name: ai_agent_ids
parameters.description: IDs of the AI agents for which the calls are to be fetched. AI Agent IDs can be accessed using List all AI agents API.

parameters.name: ivr_digit
parameters.description:
Enter the IVR digit the calls routed through which need to be filtered (optional)
Note: call_direction and call_type filter won't work in case you send ivr_digit.

parameters.name: call_direction
parameters.description: Enter the direction of calls (incoming/outgoing) to be fetched

parameters.name: call_type
parameters.description: Enter the type of calls (answered, unanswered, missed, voicemail, abandoned) that need to be fetched.

parameters.name: call_traits
parameters.description: Select one or more traits associated with a call to fetch all calls containing those traits.

parameters.name: disposition_codes
parameters.description: Filter calls by the disposition code (call outcome) added by the agent at the end of each call. You can enter an array of codes to filter calls with either of the dispositions from the list. Entered codes must already be present in your JustCall account. Expected format example - if your list title is ‘Sales‘ and your code is ‘Follow Up’ then your input in disposition field should be ‘Sales: Follow Up’.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for which calls are to be fetched

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of calls to be fetched per page. Default value is 20 and maximum value is 100.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Select a parameter to sort the order of calls. By default we apply sorting on id field.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Order in which the calls list should appear based on the 'sort' parameter selected above

parameters.name: last_call_id_fetched
parameters.description: Id of the last call fetched in the previous query. This Id ensures that you won't receive any duplicate data when using the 'next_page_link' parameter.

status.description: Status of the response

count.description: Number of records on the current page

total_count.description: Total number of records available

per_page.description: Records per page

next_page_link.description: Link to the next page

prev_page_link.description: Link to the previous page

id.description: Unique id of the call as generated by JustCall

call_sid.description: Unique call sid of the call as generated by JustCall

justcall_number.description: JustCall number used by the agent to make or receive the call

justcall_line_name.description: If line name added, the name is sent otherwise blank

agent_id.description: Id of the agent who made or received the call

agent_name.description: Name of the agent who made or received the call

agent_email.description: Email id of the agent who made or received the call

agent_active.description: Whether the agent associated with the call is active or not

call_user_date.description: Date of call in users timezone

call_user_time.description: Timestamp of call in users timezone

direction.description: Whether the call was an Outgoing call or an Incoming Calls

type.description:
A further breakdown of direction -
For Incoming direction
Answered
Missed
Voicemail
Abandoned before ringing
Busy
Failed
Blocked
Unanswered
In Progress
Restricted
For Outgoing direction
Answered
Unanswered
Abandoned before ringing
Busy
Failed
Blocked
Unanswered
In Progress
Restricted

missed_call_reason.description:
A reason for the call being missed. It can be out of -
Call arrived after your working hours
Call was not picked by any agent
Call never rang any of the available agents
missed_call_reason.default: Call arrived after your working hours

status.description: Returns “Archived” for calls which have been archived in JustCall, and returns “Unarchived” otherwise.

disposition.description: Call outcome selected by agent at the end of a call in the JustCall dialer

notes.description: Notes taken during the call or after the call from the Call Logs

rating.description: Rating added by the agent at the end of a call in the JustCall Dialer

recording_child.description: Recording child link of the call

voicemail_transcription.description: A translation of the voicemail recording into written text

call_traits.description: Comma separated list of traits associated with the call

ring_time.description: Time for which call rings before connecting with the system/agent

friendly_duration.description: Duration of call in standard hh:mm:ss format

total_duration.description: Duration of call in seconds = conversation_time+ hold_time

queue_wait_time.description: Time for which caller waited in the queue

hold_time.description: Time for which caller was put on hold, if not put on hold should be 0

conversation_time.description: Total duration without the Hold time

wrap_up_time.description: Time set by agent from adding notes & disposition after a call

digit_pressed.description: Digit of IVR pressed by user for the call

content.description: Content associated with the pressed IVR digit

entered_at_position.description: The position assigned to the caller while entering the queue basis the number of callers already waiting in the queue.

exit_reason.description:
Reason for the caller exiting from the queue. This can be out of:
- Caller got connected to a JustCall agent
- Caller exceeded maximum wait time for the JustCall number
- Caller hangup while waiting in queue

callback_requested.description: Whether or not the end customer requested a call back

callback_attempted.description: Whether or not our system attempted a call back

callback_attempted_time.description: Time when callback was attempted for the first time

callback_reached.description: Whether or not the agent picks up successfully

callback_status.description: Whether or not the user picks up successfully

callback_wait_duration.description: Duration between customer requesting the callback and our service trying for the first time

callback_reached_time.description: Time when the agent picks up the call

callback_reached_duration.description: Duration between request and when the call was picked up by the agent

call_moments.description: List of most important keywords associated with a call

customer_sentiment.description: Overall analysis of the sentiment of the customer based on words and tone

call_score.description: Overall score of the call out of 10

tags.description: Tags added by the user(agent) for a call

manual_call_score.description: Average of all manual scores added

call_summary.description: A summary of the key highlights and takeaways from a call

403.description: This error occurred when there is some validation error or you don't have access to that resource.

put.description: Utilize this endpoint to modify the notes, disposition, or rating linked to a call.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique id of the call generated by JustCall

notes.description: Add a note or replace the existing note for a call here. If a note already exists for a call, it will be replaced with the new note. The previous content will be erased.

disposition_code.description: Add or update the disposition code for a call. The code must already be present in your JustCall account. Expected format example - if your list title is ‘Sales’ and your code is ‘Follow Up’ then your input in disposition field should be ‘Sales: Follow Up’.

rating.description: Update the rating for a call. Please note that ratings should be from 0 to 5 and can contain a 0.5 decimal. Ratings like 2.5, 4.5 are allowed, while ratings like 2.3, 4.6 are not allowed.

get.description: Utilize this endpoint for retrieval of voice agent data associated with a JustCall call.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique id of the call generated by JustCall

id.description: Unique id of the call as generated by JustCall

call_sid.description: Unique call sid of the call as generated by JustCall

call_answered_by.description: Indicates who or what answered the call. Possible values: Human, Machine, or Unclassified.

voicemail_dropped.description: Indicates whether the voicemail was dropped or the call was terminated after detection.

ai_agent_name.description: Name of the AI Agent setup by the user

ai_agent_id.description: Unique id of the AI Agent setup by the user

action_count.description: Number of actions executed during the call

dynamic_variables.description: Store and access dynamic data that AI Voice Agent captures before or during the call. These variables help personalize conversations, automate actions, and keep context throughout the interaction.

before_call.description: Dynamic variables injected into the agent before the call starts. These values can be used to personalize the conversation or prefill context.

name.description: The unique identifier used to reference this variable within the agent's logic or script

value.description: The dynamic variable value injected before the call or captured during the call.

type.description: Type of the dynamic variable

during_call.description: Dynamic variables captured or injected by the AI Agent while the call is in progress. These values can be updated in real time based on the conversation.

name.description: The unique identifier used to reference this variable within the agent's logic or script

value.description: The dynamic variable value injected before the call or captured during the call.

type.description: Type of the dynamic variable

dtmf_input.description: DTMF (Dual-Tone Multi-Frequency) inputs received from the caller during the call — for example, keypad inputs like menu selections.

user_input.description: The digit pressed by the user and detected by the AI Voice Agent during the call. This will always be a single-character string such as "1", "2", "3", "*", or "#".

executed_at.description: Timestamp at which the DTMF input was received

actions.description: Details of all the actions executed during the call.

state.description: Represents the state or phase of the call lifecycle during which the action was executed.

name.description: Name of the action as defined in the voice agent configuration.

type.description: Type of the action as defined in the voice agent configuration.

status.description: Represents the current status of the action execution.

executed_at.description: Timestamp at which the action was executed.

output.description: Additional data related to the executed action. Contents vary based on the action type.

400.description: Failed due to bad request params.

403.description: This error occurred when there is some validation error or you don't have access to that resource.

500.description: This is due to internal server error reason, in this case please contact our support team with attached uuid.

get.description: Download the recording associated with a call by using the unique ID of the call.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique id of the call generated by JustCall

200.description:
Curl to download calls :

curl --location 'https://api.justcall.io/v2/calls/{id}/recording/download' \
--header 'Authorization: apikey:secretkey' --output recording.mp3

The file in this case will be downloaded as recording.mp3 on your server

get.description: Utilize this endpoint to access detailed account analytics, including metrics such as total call volume, average ring time, total call duration, SLA performance, and connect and answer rates.

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: Start date for the analytics (YYYY-MM-DD format)

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description: End date for the analytics (YYYY-MM-DD format)

metadata.description: Object containing metadata related to the analytics request.

from_date.description: Analytics period start date in YYYY-MM-DD format

to_date.description: Analytics period end date in YYYY-MM-DD format

summary.description: Object containing all the metrics for account level analytics.

total_calls.description: Total number of calls during the period (Incoming + Outgoing)

outgoing_connected_calls.description: Number of outgoing calls that were connected (answered)

outgoing_not_connected_calls.description: Number of outgoing calls not connected (busy, unanswered, failed, restricted or blocked)

outgoing_connect_rate.description: % of outgoing calls that were connected

incoming_answered_calls.description: Number of incoming calls that were answered

incoming_answer_rate.description: % of incoming calls that were answered

sla_rate_30sec.description: Percentage of calls answered within 30 sec (SLA)

incoming_missed_calls.description: Number of incoming calls that were missed

missed_during_agent_hours.description: Number of incoming calls that were missed calls during working hours (missed by agent)

missed_after_office_hours.description: Number of incoming calls that were missed after office hours

missed_abandoned_before_ringing.description: Number of incoming calls that were missed as the contact abandoned the call before it rang your team.

avg_ring_time.description: Average time before pickup in seconds

avg_talk_time.description: Average talk time per call in seconds

avg_hold_time.description: Average hold time per call in seconds

avg_handle_time.description: Average time spent handling each call in seconds (talk time + hold time + wrap-up)

avg_queue_time.description: Average queue time before pickup (in seconds)

unique_outgoing_calls.description: Unique contact numbers dialed by your team

unique_incoming_calls.description: Unique contact numbers that called you

get.description: Utilize this endpoint to fetch a list of all the users added to your JustCall account and to filter a set of users via the query parameters.

parameters.name: available
parameters.description: Use available=true to get only those agents that are available as per their working hours in JustCall. By default, we will provide data for all agents irrespective of their availability.

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: Filter agents based on the User Groups they belong to in JustCall.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: Filter agents based on the role they are assigned in JustCall.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for which user records are to be fetched

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of user records to be fetched per page. Default value is 50 and maximum value is 100.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Order in which the user records should appear based on the agent_id

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Filter agents using the email associated with their JustCall account.

status.description: Status of the response

count.description: Number of records on the current page

total_count.description: Total number of records available

per_page.description: Records per page

next_page_link.description: Link to the next page

prev_page_link.description: Link to the previous page

id.description: Unique Id of the agent (JustCall user)

post.description: Utilize this endpoint to send SMS messages via the JustCall API and leverage it for setting up SMS automation's in a third-party tool as well.

media_url.description:
If any media files need to be sent, add comma-separated URL links to media_url (Maximum 10 public links of the media having MIME type mentioned below & should not exceed the cumulative size of 5 MB.


Allowed mime type : image/jpeg, image/gif, image/x-png, image/png, image/vnd.wap.wbmp, image/x-bmp, audio/amr, audio/x-amr, audio/x-wav, audio/midi, audio/mid, audio/x-midi, audio/sp-midi, audio/rmf, audio/x-rmf, audio/x-beatnik-rmf, audio/basic, audio/mp3, video/3gpp, video/mp4, application/mp4, image/mp4, text/mp4, audio/mp4, text/vcard, text/csv, text/rtf, text/richtext, text/calendar, text/directory, application/pdf)

restrict_once.description: Set value to Yes to prevent the SMS from being sent to the same receiver in 24 hours. Default value is set to No and allows same SMS to be sent multiple times in 24 hours to the same contact.

schedule_at.description: Enter the date and time (YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss) at which the SMS is to be sent. In case no value is sent, the SMS will be sent out immediately when the API call is made.

get.description: Retrieve all Sales Dialer calls linked to an account or customize the call selection by leveraging the extensive set of query parameters available.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: Campaign ID of the Campaign for which you wish to fetch the calls. You can find the Campaign ID in the Campaigns tab in your Sales Dialer account below the name of each Campaign. Please use only the numerical part as the ID.

parameters.name: fetch_ai_data
parameters.description: Set fetch_ai_data to true to fetch coaching data by Justcall AI. Default entry is false

parameters.name: from_datetime
parameters.description: Datetime in yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss or yyyy-mm-dd format starting from when the calls are to be fetched in user's timezone.

parameters.name: to_datetime
parameters.description: Datetime in yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss or yyyy-mm-dd format till when the calls are to be fetched in user's timezone.

parameters.name: contact_number
parameters.description:
Number of the contact for which calls are to be fetched.
Important: Please provide a valid contact number with country code.

parameters.name: sales_dialer_number
parameters.description: Sales Dialer number for which the calls are to be fetched.

parameters.name: agent_id
parameters.description: ID of the agent for whom the calls are to be fetched. Agent ID can be accessed using List all users API.

parameters.name: call_type
parameters.description: Enter the type of calls (answered, unanswered, abandoned) that need to be fetched.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for which calls are to be fetched

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of calls to be fetched per page. Default value is 20 and maximum value is 100.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Select a parameter to sort the order of calls. By default we apply sorting on id field.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Order in which the calls list should appear based on the 'sort' parameter selected above

parameters.name: last_call_id_fetched
parameters.description: Id of the last call fetched in the previous query. This Id ensures that you won't receive any duplicate data when using the 'next_page_link' parameter.

status.description: Status of the response

count.description: Number of records on the current page

total_count.description: Total number of records available

per_page.description: Records per page

next_page_link.description: Link to the next page

prev_page_link.description: Link to the previous page

id.description: Id of campaign to which the contact is added when dialing

name.description: Name of campaign to which the contact is added when dialing

type.description: PowerDial, Predictive or Dynamic campaign

call_id.description: Id of the call in Sales Dialer

call_sid.description: Call sid of the call in Sales Dialer

contact_id.description: Unique id of the contact as in Sales Dialer

sales_dialer_number.description: JustCall number used by the agent to make the call

agent_id.description: Id of the agent who made the call

agent_name.description: Name of the agent who made the call

agent_email.description: Email id of the agent who made or received the call

call_user_date.description: Date of call in users timezone

call_user_time.description: Timestamp of call in users timezone

reattempt_number.description: The position of the call reattempt among all reattempts made to a particular contact in the campaign

call_answered_by.description: Whether it is the answering machine or a human

type.description:
A further breakdown of direction: 
Outgoing answered call 
Outgoing human answered 
Outgoing machine answered 
Outgoing unanswered call 
Outgoing failed call 
Outgoing restricted call 
Outgoing blocked call 
Outgoing cancelled call 
Outgoing abandoned call

friendly_duration.description: Duration of call in standard hh:mm:ss format

disposition.description: Call outcome selected by agent at the end of a call in the JustCall dialer

notes.description: Notes added for a call

rating.description: Rating added by the agent at the end of a call in the JustCall Dialer

recording.description: Recording link of the call, should be a link restricted to JustCall users

call_moments.description: List of most important keywords associated with a call

customer_sentiment.description: Overall analysis of the sentiment of the customer based on words and tone

call_score.description: Overall score of the call out of 10

get.description: Utilize this endpoint to access AI generated analysis for all instances from all the meetings or filter instances based on a specific meeting Id(applicable for recurring meetings where there are multiple instances for each meeting Id).

parameters.name: platform
parameters.description: Select the platform to retrieve associated meeting details.

parameters.name: meeting_id
parameters.description: Filter meeting instances based on the Id of the meeting. This Id is unique for each meeting URL and can have multiple instances recorded under it for recurring events under the same URL.

parameters.name: fetch_transcription
parameters.description: Set fetch_transcription to true to fetch the transcription generated by JustCall AI for your meeting instances. Default entry is false. Please note that the list of speakers is only returned along with the transcription hence it will only appear when fetch_transcription is set to true.

parameters.name: fetch_summary
parameters.description: Set fetch_summary to true to fetch the summary generated by JustCall AI for your meeting. Default entry is true.

parameters.name: fetch_ai_insights
parameters.description: Set fetch_ai_insights to true to fetch the coaching insights generated by JustCall AI for your meeting. Default entry is true.

parameters.name: fetch_smart_chapters
parameters.description: Set fetch_smart_chapters to true to fetch the smart chapters generated by JustCall AI for your meeting. Default entry is true.

parameters.name: agent_id
parameters.description: ID of the agent for whom the AI data for meetings are to be fetched. Agent ID can be accessed using List all users API.

parameters.name: from_datetime
parameters.description: Datetime in yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss or yyyy-mm-dd format starting from when the meetings AI data are to be fetched in user's timezone.

parameters.name: to_datetime
parameters.description: Datetime in yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss or yyyy-mm-dd format till when the meetings AI data are to be fetched in user's timezone.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for which meetings are to be fetched.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description:
Number count of meetings to be fetched per page.
Default value is 10 and maximum value is 20.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Order in which the meetings should appear based on ‘Date created’ASC : Older data will appear first followed by recent oneDESC: Recent data will appear first followed by older one

status.description: Status of the response

count.description: Number of records on the current page

total_count.description: Total number of records available

per_page.description: Records per page

next_page_link.description: Link to the next page

prev_page_link.description: Link to the previous page

get.description: Retrieve all WhatsApp messages linked to a JustCall account, or refine the message selection as required by utilizing the various query parameter fields.

parameters.name: fetch_template_data
parameters.description: Set fetch_template_data to true to fetch template name, category and other template specific data. Default value is “false”.

parameters.name: from_datetime
parameters.description: Datetime in yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss or yyyy-mm-dd format starting from when the messages are to be fetched.

parameters.name: to_datetime
parameters.description: Datetime in yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss or yyyy-mm-dd format till when the messages are to be fetched.

parameters.name: last_message_id_fetched
parameters.description: Id of the last WhatsApp message fetched in the previous query. This Id ensures that you won't receive any duplicate data when using the 'next_page_link' parameter.

parameters.name: contact_number
parameters.description: Number of the contact for which messages are to be fetched. Please follow the E.164 number format.

parameters.name: justcall_number
parameters.description: JustCall number for which the messages are to be fetched. Please follow the E.164 number format.

parameters.name: message_direction
parameters.description:
Enter the direction of the message to be fetched.

Note: Filtering on message_direction requires at least one from justcall_number or contact_number to be sent in the API request.

parameters.name: message_content
parameters.description:
If WhatsApp messages with specific keywords or phrases are to be fetched, enter the keywords in this field to fetch the message containing the keywords/phrases.
Enter a minimum or 3 and maximum of 15 characters.Entering more than 15 characters will lead to the endpoint responding by considering only the first 15 characters.

Note: Filtering on message_content requires at least one from justcall_number or contact_number to be sent in the API request.

parameters.name: delivery_status
parameters.description:
Fetch all the messages basis of the delivery status. Values can be from among:
- delivered
- read
- sent
- received
- failed

Note: Filtering on delivery_status requires at least one from justcall_number or contact_number to be sent in the API request.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for which messages are to be fetched.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of WhatsApp messages to be fetched per page. Default value is 30 and maximum value is 50.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Order in which the WhatsApp message list should appear based on ‘Date created’ for the message.

count.description: Number of messages present on the current page.

total_count.description: Total number of messages fetched by the API query.

per_page.description: Maximum number of messages appearing per page.

next_page_link.description: Link to the next page containing messages.

prev_page_link.description: Link to the previous page of messages.

id.description: Id of the WhatsApp message created by JustCall

justcall_number.description: JustCall number from which WhatsApp message was sent or received

justcall_line_name.description: Name of the JustCall number used to send the message

agent_id.description: Id of the agent who made or received the message

agent_name.description: Name of the agent who made or received the message

agent_email.description: Email id of the agent who sent the message

message_user_date.description: Date of message in users timezone

message_user_time.description: Timestamp of message in users timezone

direction.description: Value will be from Incoming or Outgoing

reaction_outbound_time.description: Time at which user reacted on the message

reaction_inbound_time.description: Time at which contact reacted on the message

delivery_status.description: Describes the delivery status of current message.

delivery_date.description: Date when the message was delivered

delivery_time.description: Time when the message was delivered

read_date.description: Date when the message was read

read_time.description: Time when the message was read

failure_reason.description: Reason of delivery failure in case message is in failed status

message_origin.description: From where message triggered (web only as of now)

get.description: Retrieve all contacts present in your account or filter the contacts based on one or more query parameters.

parameters.name: across_team
parameters.description: Send 'true' to fetch all contacts for all the agents from your JustCall account. Default value will be 'false'.

parameters.name: agent_ids
parameters.description: Add a list of agent_ids to fetch contacts associated with multiple agents at once.

parameters.name: contact_number
parameters.description: Phone number of the contact

parameters.name: first_name
parameters.description: First name of the contact

parameters.name: last_name
parameters.description: Last name of the contact

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of the contact from among the following - Blacklist, DND, DNM

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of contacts to be fetched per page. Default value is 50 and maximum value is 500.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for which contacts are to be fetched. Page number ‘0’ indicates first page containing records.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Order in which the contacts list should appear based on the ‘id’ of the contact. Recently added contacts are represented by larger ‘id’ values. Defaults to DESC (descending order).

parameters.name: last_contact_id_fetched
parameters.description: Id of the last contact fetched in the previous query. This Id ensures that you won't receive any duplicate data when using the `next_page_link` parameter.

status.description: Displays the status of the API request : ‘success’ for successful request; error message with description of error for failed request

count.description: Number of contacts present on the current page

per_page.description: Maximum number of contact records appearing per page

next_page_link.description: Link to the next page containing contacts

prev_page_link.description: Link to the previous page of contacts

id.description: Unique id of the contact as generated by JustCall

parent_contact_id.description: The ID of the parent contact in case this is a child contact. This field will be empty for parent contacts. The parent ID corresponds to the contact's primary phone number. A child contact represents one of the 'other numbers' added to the parent contact.

contact_number.description: Primary phone number of the contact

other_numbers.description: Other phone numbers of the contact

contact_relation_id.description: Unique identifier for the relationship between a parent contact and its other associated number.

label.description: The label for the phone number (e.g., Mobile, Home, Work)

number.description: The phone number associated with the label

extension.description: Extension assigned to the contact

company.description: Company with which the contact is associated

notes.description: Notes of the contact

id.description: The id of the note

description.example: wants a demo of AI features

added_at.description: Date and Time when the note was created

last_updated_at.description: Date and Time when the note was last updated

dnd.description: Returns true if the contact is in DND list, otherwise returns false

dnm.description: Returns true if the contact is in DNM list, otherwise returns false

delete.description: Utilize this endpoint to delete a specific contact from your JustCall account using the ‘id’ or the ‘contact_number’ of the contact. Send ‘across_team’ as true to perform the action for all agents in your account.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique id of the contact as generated by JustCall. Sending the ‘id’ will only delete the contact for the specific agent with whom this contact id is associated.

parameters.name: contact_number
parameters.description: Contact number of the contact. If the contact number is sent, JustCall will delete all contacts containing the given contact number from the owner’s account. If across_team is sent true along with the contact number, then all contacts across all agents containing given contact number will be deleted.

parameters.name: across_team
parameters.description:
Choose to delete a contact for all agents or only for the account owner.
true: Delete contact for all agents
false: Delete contact for account owner (Default)

Note: Action across entire team only works when sent with contact_number.

post.description: Utilize this endpoint to add one or more contact(s) to DND, DNM, and/or Blacklist. Invalid and duplicate numbers will be skipped, and the response will indicate added, updated, failed and skipped numbers with their respective agent IDs.

updated.description: Contacts that were already marked as any of DND/DNM/Blacklist and were updated to all provided lists.

numbers.description: List of contact numbers that were updated to the provided lists

dynamic_variables.description: Store and access dynamic data that AI Voice Agent captures before or during the call. These variables help personalize conversations, automate actions, and keep context throughout the interaction.

before_call.description: Dynamic variables injected into the agent before the call starts. These values can be used to personalize the conversation or prefill context.

name.description: The unique identifier used to reference this variable within the agent's logic or script

value.description: The dynamic variable value injected before the call or captured during the call.

type.description: Type of the dynamic variable

during_call.description: Dynamic variables captured or injected by the AI Agent while the call is in progress. These values can be updated in real time based on the conversation.

value.description: The dynamic variable value injected before the call or captured during the call.

type.description: Type of the dynamic variable

dtmf_input.description: DTMF (Dual-Tone Multi-Frequency) inputs received from the caller during the call — for example, keypad inputs like menu selections.

user_input.description: The digit pressed by the user and detected by the AI Voice Agent during the call. This will always be a single-character string such as "1", "2", "3", "*", or "#".

executed_at.description: Timestamp at which the DTMF input was received

notes.description: Add a note or replace the existing note for a call here. If a note already exists for a call, it will be replaced with the new note. The previous content will be erased.

disposition_code.description: Add or update the disposition code for a call. The code must already be present in your JustCall account. Expected format example - if your list title is ‘Sales’ and your code is ‘Follow Up’ then your input in disposition field should be ‘Sales: Follow Up’.

rating.description: Update the rating for a call. Please note that ratings should be from 0 to 5 and can contain a 0.5 decimal. Ratings like 2.5, 4.5 are allowed, while ratings like 2.3, 4.6 are not allowed.

If any media files need to be sent, add comma-separated URL links to media_url (Maximum 10 public links of the media having MIME type mentioned below & should not exceed the cumulative size of 5 MB.


Allowed mime type : image/jpeg, image/gif, image/x-png, image/png, image/vnd.wap.wbmp, image/x-bmp, audio/amr, audio/x-amr, audio/x-wav, audio/midi, audio/mid, audio/x-midi, audio/sp-midi, audio/rmf, audio/x-rmf, audio/x-beatnik-rmf, audio/basic, audio/mp3, video/3gpp, video/mp4, application/mp4, image/mp4, text/mp4, audio/mp4, text/vcard, text/csv, text/rtf, text/richtext, text/calendar, text/directory, application/pdf)

restrict_once.description: Set value to Yes to prevent the SMS from being sent to the same receiver in 24 hours. Default value is set to No and allows same SMS to be sent multiple times in 24 hours to the same contact.

schedule_at.description: Enter the date and time (YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss) at which the SMS is to be sent. In case no value is sent, the SMS will be sent out immediately when the API call is made.

status_updated_at.description: Date when the status of the blacklisted contact was last updated

created_at.description: Date when the blacklisted contact was created

last_updated_at.description: Date when the blacklisted contact was last updated

agent_id.description: Id of the agent who created the blacklisted contact

status.description: Displays the status of the API request : ‘success’ for successful request; error message with description of error for failed request

count.description: Number of blacklisted contacts present on the current page

per_page.description: Maximum number of blacklisted contact records appearing per page

next_page_link.description: Link to the next page containing blacklisted contacts

prev_page_link.description: Link to the previous page of blacklisted contacts

data.description: Array of JustCall blacklisted Contact objects

ref_id.description: A system-generated unique reference ID assigned to this blacklisted contact record.

parent_contact_id.description: The ID of the parent contact in case this is a child contact. This field will be empty for parent contacts. The parent ID corresponds to the contact's primary phone number. A child contact represents one of the 'other numbers' added to the parent contact.

name.description: Full name of the blacklisted contact

first_name.description: First name of the blacklisted contact

last_name.description: Last name of the blacklisted contact

contact_number.description: Primary phone number of the blacklisted contact

other_numbers.description: Other phone numbers of the blacklisted contact

contact_relation_id.description: Unique identifier for the relationship between a parent contact and its other associated number.

label.description: The label for the phone number (e.g., Mobile, Home, Work)

number.description: The phone number associated with the label

email.description: Email id of the blacklisted contact

extension.description: Extension assigned to the blacklisted contact

company.description: Company with which the blacklisted contact is associated

notes.description: Notes of the blacklisted contact

id.description: The id of the note

description.example: wants a demo of AI features

added_at.description: Date and Time when the note was created

last_updated_at.description: Date and Time when the note was last updated

status.description: Status of the blacklisted contact

blacklist.description: Returns true if the contact is blacklisted, otherwise returns false

dnd.description: Returns true if the contact is in DND list, otherwise returns false

dnm.description: Returns true if the contact is in DNM list, otherwise returns false

status_updated_at.description: Date when the status of the blacklisted contact was last updated

created_at.description: Date when the blacklisted contact was created

last_updated_at.description: Date when the blacklisted contact was last updated

agent_id.description: Id of the agent who created the blacklisted contact

AccessToken.description: The API key can be put in the Authorization header. i.e Authorization: api_key:api_secret. If you use cURL, specify -u “api_key:api_secret”
AccessToken.name: Authorization
